body.p: A researcher wants to determine if preschool attendance is associated with high school graduation for low-income students. She randomly assigns low-income children to two groups; one group will attend preschool program, the second group will not attend preschool. The researcher plans to follow the children in the study for 20 years and observe whether or not they graduate from high school.
Which of the following is the explanatory variable in this study?

input.choice: Whether or not a subject graduates high school
The income status of the children
Whether or not a subject attends preschool
The length of time it takes a subject to graduate high school

response.feedback: Incorrect. Whether or not a subject graduates high school is the outcome in this study. Remember an explanatory variable is the variable that claims to explain, predict or affect the response.
Incorrect. This is just a feature of the children participating in the study. Remember an explanatory variable is the variable that claims to explain, predict or affect the response.
Correct. Preschool attendance is what the researcher thinks predicts high school graduation.

Incorrect. The length of time to graduate high school could be an outcome in this study, but is not the explanatory variable. Remember an explanatory variable is the variable that claims to explain, predict or affect the response.
